pullRequest.body:
Refactor morphisms in ProfiniteGrp into one-field structure.

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:

- ...

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

nodes.body: messageFile.md
Could you please add a test file in `MathlibTest`, similar to the one for `AlgebraCat`?

I think this is pretty much good to go. I am less convinced we need that extra test file, since we do exactly the same as for `AlgebraCat`/`ModuleCat`/`RingCat`, so there should not be any surprises. But those tests are quite helpful for my follow-up work on the concrete category class. So I certainly wouldn't oppose more test files :)

> I think this is pretty much good to go. I am less convinced we need that extra test file, since we do exactly the same as for `AlgebraCat`/`ModuleCat`/`RingCat`, so there should not be any surprises. But those tests are quite helpful for my follow-up work on the concrete category class. So I certainly wouldn't oppose more test files :)

So which one do you prefer? Adding test file right in this PR or in another one?
We should add it in this PR definitely. (Assuming you want to add it at all: having thought about it a bit more, I'm in favour of having the test file, but will not insist if you are not.)

> We should add it in this PR definitely. (Assuming you want to add it at all: having thought about it a bit more, I'm in favour of having the test file, but will not insist if you are not.)

Currently, 9 out of 14 failed.... I may need some time to fix.
Probably because of `ContinuousMonoidHom` is missing API every where....
messageFile.md

> > We should add it in this PR definitely. (Assuming you want to add it at all: having thought about it a bit more, I'm in favour of having the test file, but will not insist if you are not.)
> 
> Currently, 9 out of 14 failed.... I may need some time to fix. Probably because of `ContinuousMonoidHom` is missing API every where....

This is why I wanted the test file :) Thanks!

### PR summary [022323a991](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20740/commits/022323a9918855343597032d53bd51bd103dbf29)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph

</details>

#### Declarations diff

`+ instance : HasForget₂ ProfiniteGrp Profinite`
`+ instance : Limits.PreservesLimits (forget₂ ProfiniteGrp Profinite)`
`+ instance : TopologicalGroup (Profinite.limitCone (F ⋙ (forget₂ ProfiniteGrp Profinite))).pt`

`+ ofHom_hom`
`+ ofHom_id`

`- instance : Limits.PreservesLimits profiniteGrpToProfinite.{u}`
`- instance : TopologicalGroup (Profinite.limitCone (F ⋙ profiniteGrpToProfinite.{max v u})).pt`

  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

@Vierkantor: This PR is now using `HasForget`. What do you think, is it okay to proceed with this PR for now and do the implementation of the new `ConcreteCategory` in a follow-up PR? I think it is okay not to burden Nailin with the implementation of the new design while there are no (merged) examples to point to in the library.

> What do you think, is it okay to proceed with this PR for now and do the implementation of the new ConcreteCategory in a follow-up PR?

Agreed, let's wait for that line of work to settle.
Do anyone know why lint failed here? Sorry that I have no idea about it.

> Do anyone know why lint failed here? Sorry that I have no idea about it.

I think github is having issues right now, I don't think there is anything wrong with your PR.

> Do anyone know why lint failed here? Sorry that I have no idea about it.

I think github is having issues right now, I don't think there is anything wrong with your PR.

> Do anyone know why lint failed here? Sorry that I have no idea about it.

I think github is having issues right now, I don't think there is anything wrong with your PR.

Thanks!

maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by chrisflav.
@Vierkantor, could you do the final review/merge?

:v: Thmoas-Guan can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Is this OK for now?
Modulo the comment above and the merge conflict, this looks good, thanks!

Looks good, thanks!

bors r+

Thank you for taking this on! I'm happy to see the amount of required changes was much less than for some of the other concrete categories. :)

A few small remarks.
Sorry, forgot about that one, thanks for doing this! Last nit picks.
Modulo the comment above and the merge conflict, this looks good, thanks!

Looks good with some minor fixes, thanks! I think it should be easy enough to turn this into a new-style `ConcreteCategory` afterwards.

bors d+

Looks good, thanks!

bors r+
Please don't forget to replace references to algebras in the comments :)

If I understand correctly, the `Category ProfiniteAddGrp` instance can't be generated by `@[to_additive]` because `mk` is private, which `to_additive` does not support. Is that the case? Could you add a comment explaining why we have to manually make these instances? (The same for `ofHom`.)
I think this is the reason, when removing private it works.

```suggestion
/-- Typecheck a `ContinuousAddMonoidHom` as a morphism in `AddProfiniteGrp`. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- Typecheck a `ContinuousMonoidHom` as a morphism in `ProfiniteGrp`. -/
```

```suggestion
abbrev ProfiniteAddGrp.ofHom {X Y : Type u} [AddGroup X] [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalAddGroup X]
```
same below

```suggestion
@[to_additive (attr := ext) existing]
```
I think.
You are correct.
I think this should not fail. Does it work with the `to_additive existing` comment I made above?

`to_additive existing` attribute fails too, error is like this
![图片](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/137abaae-5e24-4dee-bc13-c5b73bbfd509)

Ah this fails again because `to_additive` doesn't work with `private` constructors in structures (if you temporarily remove the `private` in the `Hom` structures it works). So please add a comment here why it does not work (similar to the one on the category instance). Then put `to_additive existing` instead.

Note that you have to move `HasForget₂ FiniteAddGrp ProfiniteAddGrp` to the `ProfiniteAddGrp` namespace, otherwise `to_additive existing` won't find it.
Thanks, I moved it to the `ProfiniteAddGrp` namespace then it worked.

I figured out how to make `to_additive` understand private declarations: if you register the attribute yourself, then it works:
```suggestion
attribute [to_additive existing ProfiniteAddGrp.Hom.mk] ProfiniteGrp.Hom.mk

@[to_additive]
instance : Category ProfiniteGrp where
  Hom A B := ProfiniteGrp.Hom A B
  id A := ⟨ContinuousMonoidHom.id A⟩
  comp f g := ⟨g.hom.comp f.hom⟩
```
Thanks for the great idea!

With the `to_additive` on `Hom.mk`:
```suggestion
/-- Typecheck a `ContinuousMonoidHom` as a morphism in `ProfiniteGrp`. -/
@[to_additive "Typecheck a `ContinuousAddMonoidHom` as a morphism in `ProfiniteAddGrp`."]
```

Shouldn't this also be `to_additive`'d?
```suggestion
@[to_additive (attr := simp)]
```
sorry, a mistake.

With `to_additive` on `Hom.mk`, this can become:
```suggestion
@[to_additive]
```
All of the declarations starting here are missing `@[to_additive]`. Or is there a reason for that?
No, it is only because previously `to_additive` some how failed and many things are missing API for the add version, I should add it now.

however is this a bug for `to_additive` ?
![图片](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a1293d91-e6c9-48ca-a1a6-52fd4291e41b)
it somehow didn't transport the `Group` instance.

Hmm, that's weird. And if I make the instance manually and add `@[to_additive existing]` then `@[to_additive]` on the `TopologicalGroup` doesn't work either... Don't know how to fix that, and it feels like we're getting off the purpose of this PR. So if we can't fix it now it's fine to leave this as a TODO.
Almost everything broke after `limitConePtAux`, need to fix using `attribute @[to_additive]` which I think isn't a good idea, I'll leave a TODO then.

pullRequest.title: refactor(Topology/Group): turn morphisms in ProfiniteGrp into one field structures
